item.itunes:title: 20 years of hacking Postgres with Heikki Linnakangas (cofounder of Neon)

From paternity leave patches to branching production databases, we cover a lot of ground in this deep-dive conversation.Â

item.title: Building a serverless database replica with Carl Sverre
item.itunes:title: Building a serverless database replica with Carl Sverre
item.description:
Want to learn more SQLite? Check out my SQLite course: https://highperformancesqlite.comÂ 

In this episode, Carl Sverre and I discuss why syncing everything is a bad idea and how his new project, Graft, makes edge-native, partially replicated databases possible. We dig into SQLite, object storage, transactional guarantees, and why Graft might be the foundation for serverless database replicas.Â
